# Introduction {.unnumbered}

*This chapter is under development. Check back soon for the full content.*

## What This Chapter Will Cover

- The business model of Islamic banking and deposit/financing mechanisms
- Profit-and-loss sharing (PLS) accounts and their practical implementation
- Asset-liability management in Islamic banks
- The role of Shari'ah boards and Shari'ah-compliant oversight
- Sukuk market structure and international development
- Islamic stock markets and equity trading
- Regulatory frameworks in major Islamic finance hubs
- Financial stability and risk management in Islamic institutions
- Challenges of form versus substance in Islamic finance practice

::: {.callout-tip title="Key Concept"}
Islamic banking fundamentally restructures the relationship between banks and customers: banks function as profit-sharing partners rather than creditors, replacing depositor interest with profit-sharing arrangements that align incentives and distribute both risk and return more equitably.
:::
